titlepage.titleproper:
Finding aid for
Tommy Good collection, 1963-2006
titlepage.author:
Finding aid created by
Alexa Hagen in 2016

did.abstract: Tommy Good was a Motown recording artist in the early 1960s. His collection includes programs from Motown concerts, one of which was signed by Stevie Wonder. It also includes audio recordings of songs he performed as well as a song written and sung by Berry Gordy for Good.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: Donated by Thomas N. Good (donor no. 10826), in October, 2012. 10826

accruals.p: No further additions to the collection are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research. Digitized audio files are currently available only in the Bentley Historical Library reading room on designated Bentley Library computers.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan. Rights to the audiovisual content have not been transferred to the Regents.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Tommy Good collection, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

altformavail.p: Digitization: The Library has undertaken the digitization of a number of sound recordings within this collection. The resulting audio files are available for playback only in the Bentley Library Reading Room. Links to item images and additional information are available within this finding aid. Original sound recordings are only available for staff use.

bioghist.p: Tommy Good grew up in suburban Detroit and was discovered while performing at a local club with his band, Tommy Good and the Tabs. He became a recording artist on the Gordy label, a subsidiary of Motown. He released only one song, "Baby I Miss You", with the label in 1964, but recorded many others that remained unreleased until a compilation CD was produced in 2006.

scopecontent.p: The Tommy Good collection includes programs for Motown productions including the Motor Town Revue (1964) and Americans in Harmony (1965). Sound recordings include a tape of Berry Gordy singing "Bad Bad Baby," a song he wrote for Good and a 2006 compilation CD of Good's Motown recordings with some accompanying notes. The collection has been organized into two series: Programs and Sound Recordings.

The Library has undertaken the digitization of sound recordings within this collection. The resulting audio files are available for playback only in the Bentley Library Reading Room. Links to item images and additional information are available within this finding aid. Original sound recordings are available for staff use only.
